Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 6

Intermediate

Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 6

Master these essential intermediate words that will help you communicate more effectively in both academic and professional settings.

Navigation

This is page 6 of 15. Use the navigation below to explore all vocabulary pages.

Word List

Acknowledge

/əkˈnɑːlɪdʒ/

verb

To accept or admit the existence or truth of something.

"He acknowledged his mistakes and apologized."

Synonyms: admit, recognize, accept

Category: Recognition

Analyze

/ˈænəlaɪz/

verb

To examine methodically and in detail the constitution or structure of something.

"Scientists analyze data to draw conclusions."

Synonyms: examine, study, investigate

Category: Investigation

Approximately

/əˈprɑːksəmətli/

adverb

Used to show that something is almost, but not completely, accurate or exact.

"The meeting will last approximately two hours."

Synonyms: roughly, about, around

Category: Estimation

Assume

/əˈsuːm/

verb

To suppose to be the case, without proof.

"I assume you've already finished your homework."

Synonyms: suppose, presume, believe

Category: Assumption

Available

/əˈveɪləbəl/

adjective

Able to be used or obtained; at someone's disposal.

"The book is available in the library."

Synonyms: accessible, obtainable, free

Category: Accessibility

Benefit

/ˈbenəfɪt/

noun, verb

An advantage or profit gained from something.

"Regular exercise has many health benefits."

Synonyms: advantage, profit, gain

Category: Advantage

Calculate

/ˈkælkjəleɪt/

verb

To determine the amount or number of something mathematically.

"Please calculate the total cost of the items."

Synonyms: compute, determine, figure out

Category: Mathematics

Challenge

/ˈtʃælɪndʒ/

noun, verb

A call to take part in a contest or competition; to dispute or question.

"Learning a new language is always a challenge."

Synonyms: difficulty, obstacle, test

Category: Difficulty

Communicate

/kəˈmjuːnəkeɪt/

verb

To convey or exchange information, ideas, or feelings.

"It's important to communicate clearly with your team."

Synonyms: convey, express, share

Category: Communication

Community

/kəˈmjuːnəti/

noun

A group of people living in the same place or having a particular characteristic in common.

"The local community organized a charity event."

Synonyms: society, neighborhood, group

Category: Society

Compare

/kəmˈper/

verb

To estimate, measure, or note the similarity or dissimilarity between things.

"Let's compare the prices of different laptops."

Synonyms: contrast, examine, evaluate

Category: Analysis

Complete

/kəmˈpliːt/

adjective, verb

Having all the necessary or appropriate parts; to finish making or doing.

"Please complete the form and return it by Friday."

Synonyms: finish, conclude, fulfill

Category: Completion
